document.name: AdobePhotoshop.txt

annotations.text: What information does Adobe collect about me?
Adobe ID, registration and customer support

When you register to use an Adobe Service, create an Adobe ID, purchase a licence to our Services and Software or contact us for support or other offerings, Adobe collects information that identifies you
Content of and information provided through customer support
e.g., recorded customer and technical support calls and stored content of your correspondence with us via our website, chat features, phone and video calls, emails and other channels
e.g., student or teacher identification for student and teacher editions of apps
content of your correspondence with us
Types of Services and Software of interest
Professional, education or other demographic information
such as the size, industry and other information about the company where a user may work (when the user has provided the company name)
Analytics or other electronic network activity
size, industry and other information about the company

To help keep our databases current and to provide you the most relevant content and experiences, we may infer or generate information based on the information we collect or combine information provided by you with information from third party sources, in accordance with applicable law.
We collect information you provide to us (e.g., when you access and use our Services and Software) or permit us to collect (e.g., as part of a third-party integration).
e.g., when you access and use our Services and Software
access and use our Services and Software
information about how you access and use our Services and Software
including when you use a desktop or mobile app feature that takes you online (such as a photo syncing feature)
use a desktop or mobile app feature that takes you online
such as a photo syncing feature

We also collect or generate information about how you access and use our Services and Software, including when you use a desktop or mobile app feature that takes you online (such as a photo syncing feature).
Depending on the Services and Software you access and use, this information may be associated with your device or browser or it may be associated with your Adobe account or content.
Analytics or other electronic network activity
including browser and device type, settings, unique identifiers, version, language settings and configuration
Use and navigation of Services and Software
including how you interact with Adobe websites (collected through cookies and similar technologies or by Adobe servers when you are logged into the app or website
how you interact with Adobe websites
use and navigation of the Services and Software
Professional, Education or other demographic information

such as:
Profile information (e.g., account profile, public profile, Behance profile)
e.g., account profile, public profile, Behance profile

such as:
Content that includes personal information which is sent or received using an online feature of Adobe Services and Software or which is stored on Adobe servers, such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content, user generated requests such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software as well as any information the Services and Software returns in response to such requests

such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content, user generated requests such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software as well as any information the Services and Software returns in response to such requests
e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use
information about the company you work for
information provided by you with information from third party sources

For example, the size, industry and other information about the company you work for (where you have provided company name) will be obtained from sources including, professional networking sites and information service providers.

We may also infer, generate or collect and receive information from third parties, including partners and from publicly accessible sources, for purposes that include to detect, prevent or otherwise address fraudulent, deceptive or illegal activity, misuse of our Services and Software, security or technical issues, as well as to protect against harm to the rights, property or safety of Adobe and our employees, our users, children or the public.

such as:
Biometric identifiers or information as defined under US laws (e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use) and precise geolocation

Commercial and transaction information, such as:
Content that includes personal information which is sent or received using an online feature of Adobe Services and Software or which is stored on Adobe servers, such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content, user generated requests such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software as well as any information the Services and Software returns in response to such requests.

Sensitive personal information, such as:
Biometric identifiers or information as defined under US laws (e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use) and precise geolocation.

What information does Adobe collect about me?

When you register to use an Adobe Service, create an Adobe ID, purchase a licence to our Services and Software or contact us for support or other offerings, Adobe collects information that identifies you.
including how you interact with Adobe websites
including browser and device type, settings, unique identifiers, version, language settings and configuration
Analysis of your use and navigation of the Services
e.g., account profile, public profile, Behance profile

such as:
Profile information (e.g., account profile, public profile, Behance profile)
e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.
any information the Services and Software returns in response
e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use
clicked a link in the email
such as whether you have received or opened the email or clicked a link in the email

such as:
 
Which ads are displayed;
Which ads are clicked; and 
Where the ad was displayed
such as name, country and basic demographic information
information which you have made publicly available on your social networking account
interests in our products and services
information about your use of these features
such as content “liked” and address information in Google Maps
For example, the size, industry and other information about the company you work for (where you have provided company name) will be obtained from sources

For example, the size, industry and other information about the company you work for (where you have provided company name) will be obtained from sources including, professional networking sites and information service providers
We collect information you provide to us (e.g., when you access and use our Services and Software) or permit us to collect (e.g., as part of a third-party integration).

We also collect or generate information about how you access and use our Services and Software, including when you use a desktop or mobile app feature that takes you online (such as a photo syncing feature).
Use and navigation of Services and Software

Professional, Education or other demographic information, such as:
Profile information (e.g., account profile, public profile, Behance profile).
such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content
such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software
information as defined under US laws

Sensitive personal information, such as:
Biometric identifiers or information as defined under US laws (e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use) and precise geolocation.

such as:
Biometric identifiers or information as defined under US laws (e.g., faceprints and voiceprints from your user Content, as defined in the Adobe General Terms of Use) and precise geolocation

such as:
Content that includes personal information which is sent or received using an online feature of Adobe Services and Software or which is stored on Adobe servers, such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content, user generated requests such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software as well as any information the Services and Software returns in response to such requests

Commercial and transaction information, such as:
Content that includes personal information which is sent or received using an online feature of Adobe Services and Software or which is stored on Adobe servers, such as documents, photos, videos, activity logs, direct feedback from you, metadata about your content, user generated requests such as search terms, prompts (e.g., text, images, videos, audio etc.), enquiries, feedback and other information you may disclose when you access or use our Services and Software as well as any information the Services and Software returns in response to such requests.

Emails we send you may include a technology (called a web beacon) that collects Analytics or other electronic network activity, such as whether you have received or opened the email or clicked a link in the email.

We collect Analytics or other electronic network activity information such as:
 
Which ads are displayed;
Which ads are clicked; and 
Where the ad was displayed.
such as from CCTV video or voice recordings and photos

When you visit an Adobe office, we will collect Identifiers and Contact information such as your name, company name and email address; and Audio, electronic, visual or similar information including facial images and voice information such as from CCTV video or voice recordings and photos.

In addition, when you see or interact with these buttons, tools or content or view an Adobe web page or app containing them, some information from your browser may automatically be sent to the other company.
We may collect information about your use of these features, such as content “liked” and address information in Google Maps.
such as device and application data

Enterprise collects hardware and software information, such as device and application data and sends it to Google for purposes of providing, maintaining and improving reCAPTCHA Enterprise and for general security purposes.
identifier information about you from your social networking account
Where you give appropriate permissions, we will receive contact and identifier information about you from your social networking account, such as name, country and basic demographic information.
for example, for the address book contacts shared by users when entering recipient information

In certain instances, Adobe is acting only on your behalf for personal information collected and processed by our services (for example, for the address book contacts shared by users when entering recipient information).
such as name and interests in our products and services, when you interact with our social networking pages

We will collect information which you have made publicly available on your social networking account, such as name and interests in our products and services, when you interact with our social networking pages.

Adobe offers certain features that let you edit and organise your photographs, videos and other types of content using characteristics like face and voice (e.g., you can group similar faces, places and image characteristics within your collection) and such characteristics may be considered biometric identifiers or biometric information under certain US laws or other applicable privacy laws.
e.g., where this is required before you can start using your product
such as whether you have received or opened the email or clicked a link in the email

such as your name, company name and email address

Adobe offers certain features that let you edit and organise your photographs, videos and other types of content using characteristics like face and voice (e.g., you can group similar faces, places and image characteristics within your collection) and such characteristics may be considered biometric identifiers or biometric information under certain US laws or other applicable privacy laws.

In certain instances, Adobe is acting only on your behalf for personal information collected and processed by our services (for example, for the address book contacts shared by users when entering recipient information).

Adobe websites may implement Google reCAPTCHA Enterprise to help prevent spam and abuse. reCAPTCHA Enterprise collects hardware and software information, such as device and application data and sends it to Google for purposes of providing, maintaining and improving reCAPTCHA Enterprise and for general security purposes.
